revised_title: Laboratory Studies of Oxygen Airglow Mechanism
tldr: The authors conducted laboratory experiments to study the mechanism of the oxygen airglow. They found that the Barth mechanism, involving three-body recombination of oxygen atoms, is responsible for the auroral green line emission at 557.7 nm in the Earth's atmosphere. The results support the Barth mechanism and provide insights into the quenching processes involved in the airglow phenomenon.
